wikipedia_page.main: Horace Mayhew (1816 – 30 April 1872) was an English journalist, a writer of humorous sketches and a sub-editor of the magazine Punch.

response: * George Cruikshank publishes The Preparatory School for Fast Men, a gag comic which makes use of speech balloons to tell a sequential story. The same year he and Horace Mayhew create the lengthy humor comic The Tooth-Ache.

Horace Mayhew (20 June 1845 – 15 August 1926Burke's Landed Gentry, 1965, 18th Edn pp 495) of Broughton Hall, Flintshire,Page 76, A History of the Old Parish of Hawarden. T.W. Pritchard. 2002. Bridge Books. Wrexham was a British mining engineer and colliery owner who founded the town of Broughton, Nova Scotia, now one of Canada's most famous ghost towns.Source: 1923 Colliery Year Book and Coal Trades Directory. Published by The Louis Cassier Co. Ltd., from a copy held in the Scottish Mining Museum, Newtongrange, Midlothian He was the son of John Mayhew Esq of Platt Bridge House, Co. Lancaster, and Elizabeth Mayhew (née Rapley),Burke's Genealogical and Heraldic History of the Landed Gentry of Great Britain and Ireland Vol 1 [1894] pp1368 JP Lancashire (1876), JP Flintshire (1888), Deputy Lieutenant (1900), and High Sheriff of Flintshire (1904).

In the early 20th Century Horace Mayhew and Thomas Lancaster founded the town of Broughton, Nova Scotia and established the Cape Breton Coal, Iron & Railway Company.'ACAP proposes takeover of Broughton ruins' Cape Breton Post, Sydney, July 23rd 2007. Mayhew was President of the company and also President of the Canada Land & Development Corporation on whose land the town of Broughton was built. He was extensively involved in the planning of Broughton and invested heavily in the development of the town and mines, of which there were several workable seams.
